titleStmt.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Robert S. Townsend, October 4, 1969
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, John Gneisenau, 1881-1973

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Neihardt, John Gneisenau, 1881-1973
bibl.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Robert S. Townsend

revisionDesc.change: Weakly, Laura K. Added keywords and correspDesc

div1.p: I have just received your letter of October 2, and I was delighted to hear from you again. I am especialy pleased to know that you are editor of Missouri Highways. Naturally I am interested in your plan to run an article on me and my work.

As my daughter Alice told you, I will be at Skyrim Thursday afternoon through Saturday, October 23 through 25. I will have to return to Lincoln on Sunday, October 26. On one of those days my secretary and I will need to work in the manuscripts collection. I suggest that you choose a suitable time for yourself and your photographers and let me know when you can meet me at Skyrim. I will then plan to be there at that time.
I have a feeling that you are going to make a great success with your magazine, and you have my best wishes.
I remember our old days together with real pleasure, Robert, and I know well your capabilities.

postscript.p: I am including some material that may be of use to you in planning the article.
